output.name: EPFL Center for Imaging
output.organizationTypeJustification: The EPFL Center for Imaging is a central service and research facility at EPFL, providing imaging infrastructure, training and software tools for academic research; its website uses the EPFL domain and it is listed as an EPFL organizational unit in Infoscience.
output.description: The EPFL Center for Imaging is an academic core facility within EPFL that develops and provides advanced imaging services, open-source software tools, workshops and training in image analysis for life sciences, physics and engineering research.

alternateNames: Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne
relatedToOrganization.parentOrganization: Board of the Swiss Federal Institutes of Technology

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Matched via Infoscience lab search tool for 'Centre for Imaging'.

disciplineJustification: The organization’s repositories and workshops (napari plugins, image analysis tutorials) indicate expertise in image processing and algorithm development, mapping to Information engineering.
Numerous software projects and plugins demonstrate software engineering and tool development, aligning with Computer engineering.
The focus on imaging modalities and analysis for biological specimens and preclinical studies corresponds to Biological engineering.
Projects like mousetumortrack, mouselungseg and Mito_nucleoid_distances reflect applications in Biology.
Workshops and tools for biomedical imaging, tumor analysis and health-related image analysis map to Health sciences.
output.relatedToEPFLJustification:
Comprehensive EPFL relationship assessment:

1. Organization Name Contains "EPFL" (ORGANIZATION_NAME, 0.5):
   - The GitHub organization 'name' is "EPFL Center for Imaging", clearly including "EPFL".

2. Parent Organization is École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne (PARENT_ORGANIZATION, 0.6):
   - The relatedToOrganization data lists the parentOrganization as "École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne" (EPFL).

3. Website Domain Uses epfl.ch (WEBSITE_DOMAIN, 0.5):
   - The blog URL is "https://imaging.epfl.ch", an *.epfl.ch domain.

4. Description Explicitly Mentions EPFL (BIO_MENTION, 0.3):
   - The organization description states: "The EPFL Center for Imaging is an academic core facility within EPFL...".

5. Infoscience Entity Found (INFOSCIENCE_ENTITY, 0.4):
   - academicCatalogRelations includes an Infoscience orgunit "Centre for Imaging" matching the EPFL Center for Imaging.

Summing contributions: 0.5 + 0.6 + 0.5 + 0.3 + 0.4 = 2.3, capped at 1.0. The cumulative confidence exceeds the 0.5 threshold, thus relatedToEPFL = true.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Publication authored by Edward Andò, who is affiliated with IMAGING-GE, a unit of the Centre for Imaging.

entity.title: Single-projection reconstruction technique for positioning monodisperse spheres in 3D with a divergent x-ray beam
entity.abstract: The measurement of the position of single-sized spheres in 3D from a single, divergent, radiographic projection is addressed in the present study with the development of a novel method. Generally speaking, the location of the shadow cast by a single sphere on a detector defines a source-detector ray...
